did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Ledger for a merchant operating in Montgomery County, VA. Entries date from 1881 through 1888. Goods were sold by William G. Sarvay beginning January 1, 1881. The business was sold to Sarvay's step-son, Charles Lyle on March 1, 1883.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Sarvay-Lyle Ledger must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Sarvay-Lyle Ledger, Ms2011-067, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Sarvay-Lyle Ledger was completed in August 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Charles Lyle attended the Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College from 1878 to 1879 and again from 1882 to 1883.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Ledger contains cash accounts and goods sold by William G. Sarvay in Montgomery County, Virginia beginning in 1881. The business was sold to Charles Lyle in 1883. Ledger includes an account for the Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College. Items sold include food items, shoes, clothing, and household goods. Entries date through March 1888.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged by material type.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional records from Sarvay's store can be found in the Rufus Sarvey Papers, Ms1962-003.
